channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: TSegFormer: 3D Tooth Segmentation in Intraoral Scans with Geometry Guided Transformer
item.description: Optical Intraoral Scanners (IOS) are widely used in digital dentistry to provide detailed 3D information of dental crowns and the gingiva.

item.title: DRIFu: Differentiable Rendering and Implicit Function-based Single-View 3D Reconstruction
item.description: Our innovative alignment tools play a pivotal role in mapping these diverse synthetic animal models onto a unified template, facilitating precise predictions of animal shape and texture.

item.title: Naturalness of Attention: Revisiting Attention in Code Language Models
item.description: Language models for code such as CodeBERT offer the capability to learn advanced source code representation, but their opacity poses barriers to understanding of captured properties.

item.title: A projected nonlinear state-space model for forecasting time series signals
item.description: Learning and forecasting stochastic time series is essential in various scientific fields.

item.title: ComPEFT: Compression for Communicating Parameter Efficient Updates via Sparsification and Quantization
item.description: Despite the efficiency of PEFT methods, the size of expert models can make it onerous to retrieve expert models per query over high-latency networks like the Internet or serve multiple experts on a single GPU.

item.title: DA-STC: Domain Adaptive Video Semantic Segmentation via Spatio-Temporal Consistency
item.description: To solve the challenge, we propose a novel DA-STC method for domain adaptive video semantic segmentation, which incorporates a bidirectional multi-level spatio-temporal fusion module and a category-aware spatio-temporal feature alignment module to facilitate consistent learning for domain-invariant features.

item.title: Lightweight High-Speed Photography Built on Coded Exposure and Implicit Neural Representation of Videos
item.description: In this work, by leveraging classical coded exposure imaging technique and emerging implicit neural representation for videos, we tactfully embed the motion direction cues into the blurry image during the imaging process and develop a novel self-recursive neural network to sequentially retrieve the latent video sequence from the blurry image utilizing the embedded motion direction cues.

item.title: Applications of Spiking Neural Networks in Visual Place Recognition
item.description: Lastly, we investigate the role of sequence matching in SNN-based VPR, a technique where consecutive images are used to refine place recognition.

item.title: Diffusion360: Seamless 360 Degree Panoramic Image Generation based on Diffusion Models
item.description: This is a technical report on the 360-degree panoramic image generation task based on diffusion models.

item.title: Applying Dimensionality Reduction as Precursor to LSTM-CNN Models for Classifying Imagery and Motor Signals in ECoG-Based BCIs
item.description: Motor impairments, frequently caused by neurological incidents like strokes or traumatic brain injuries, present substantial obstacles in rehabilitation therapy.

item.title: SegVol: Universal and Interactive Volumetric Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Despite the remarkable progress achieved in medical image segmentation, there is still an absence of foundation segmentation model that can segment a wide range of anatomical categories with easy user interaction.

item.title: PG-Video-LLaVA: Pixel Grounding Large Video-Language Models
item.description: Extending image-based Large Multimodal Models (LMM) to videos is challenging due to the inherent complexity of video data.

item.title: Efficient Numerical Integration in Reproducing Kernel Hilbert Spaces via Leverage Scores Sampling
item.description: In this work we consider the problem of numerical integration, i. e., approximating integrals with respect to a target probability measure using only pointwise evaluations of the integrand.

item.title: DAE-Net: Deforming Auto-Encoder for fine-grained shape co-segmentation
item.description: We present an unsupervised 3D shape co-segmentation method which learns a set of deformable part templates from a shape collection.

item.title: Accelerating Inference in Molecular Diffusion Models with Latent Representations of Protein Structure
item.description: Diffusion generative models have emerged as a powerful framework for addressing problems in structural biology and structure-based drug design.

item.title: Immunohistochemistry guided segmentation of benign epithelial cells, in situ lesions, and invasive epithelial cells in breast cancer slides
item.description: In this study, we aimed to develop an AI model for segmentation of epithelial cells in sections from breast cancer.

item.title: Toward Robust Imperceptible Perturbation against Unauthorized Text-to-image Diffusion-based Synthesis
item.description: To solve these challenges, we propose MetaCloak, which solves the bi-level poisoning problem with a meta-learning framework with an additional transformation sampling process to craft transferable and robust perturbation.

item.title: From Images to Connections: Can DQN with GNNs learn the Strategic Game of Hex?
item.description: The gameplay of strategic board games such as chess, Go and Hex is often characterized by combinatorial, relational structures -- capturing distinct interactions and non-local patterns -- and not just images.

item.title: SkeletonGait: Gait Recognition Using Skeleton Maps
item.description: In this paper, we introduce a novel skeletal gait representation named Skeleton Map, together with SkeletonGait, a skeleton-based method to exploit structural information from human skeleton maps.

item.title: Robot at the Mirror: Learning to Imitate via Associating Self-supervised Models
item.description: We introduce an approach to building a custom model from ready-made self-supervised models via their associating instead of training and fine-tuning.

item.title: Soulstyler: Using Large Language Model to Guide Image Style Transfer for Target Object
item.description: We introduce a large language model to parse the text and identify stylization goals and specific styles.

item.title: ViStruct: Visual Structural Knowledge Extraction via Curriculum Guided Code-Vision Representation
item.description: We adopt a weakly-supervised approach to directly generate visual event structures from captions for ViStruct training, capitalizing on abundant image-caption pairs from the web.

item.title: Hard Label Black Box Node Injection Attack on Graph Neural Networks
item.description: In this work, we will propose a non-targeted Hard Label Black Box Node Injection Attack on Graph Neural Networks, which to the best of our knowledge, is the first of its kind.

item.title: Volumetric Reconstruction Resolves Off-Resonance Artifacts in Static and Dynamic PROPELLER MRI
item.description: Off-resonance artifacts in magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) are visual distortions that occur when the actual resonant frequencies of spins within the imaging volume differ from the expected frequencies used to encode spatial information.

item.title: FusionFrames: Efficient Architectural Aspects for Text-to-Video Generation Pipeline
item.description: The first stage concerns keyframes synthesis to figure the storyline of a video, while the second one is devoted to interpolation frames generation to make movements of the scene and objects smooth.

item.title: Enhancing Uncertainty-Based Hallucination Detection with Stronger Focus
item.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) have gained significant popularity for their impressive performance across diverse fields.

item.title: Animatable 3D Gaussians for High-fidelity Synthesis of Human Motions
item.description: The learnable code serves as a pose-dependent appearance embedding for refining the erroneous appearance caused by geometric transformation of Gaussians, based on which an appearance refinement model is learned to produce residual Gaussian properties to match the appearance in target pose.

item.title: REDS: Resource-Efficient Deep Subnetworks for Dynamic Resource Constraints
item.description: REDS support conventional deep networks frequently deployed on the edge and provide computational benefits even for small and simple networks.

item.title: Learning to Fly in Seconds
item.description: Our framework enables Simulation-to-Reality (Sim2Real) transfer for direct RPM control after only 18 seconds of training on a consumer-grade laptop as well as its deployment on microcontrollers to control a multirotor under real-time guarantees.

item.title: FuseNet: Self-Supervised Dual-Path Network for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Semantic segmentation, a crucial task in computer vision, often relies on labor-intensive and costly annotated datasets for training.

item.title: Stable Unlearnable Example: Enhancing the Robustness of Unlearnable Examples via Stable Error-Minimizing Noise
item.description: Observing that simply removing the adversarial noise on the training process of the defensive noise can improve the performance of robust unlearnable examples, we identify that solely the surrogate model's robustness contributes to the performance.

item.title: Physical Reasoning and Object Planning for Household Embodied Agents
item.description: In this study, we explore the sophisticated domain of task planning for robust household embodied agents, with a particular emphasis on the intricate task of selecting substitute objects.

item.title: LM-Cocktail: Resilient Tuning of Language Models via Model Merging
item.description: Despite simplicity, LM-Cocktail is surprisingly effective: the resulted model is able to achieve a strong empirical performance in the whole scope of general tasks while preserving a superior capacity in its targeted domain.

item.title: Visual In-Context Prompting
item.description: In-context prompting in large language models (LLMs) has become a prevalent approach to improve zero-shot capabilities, but this idea is less explored in the vision domain.

item.title: Detecting out-of-distribution text using topological features of transformer-based language models
item.description: We attempt to detect out-of-distribution (OOD) text samples though applying Topological Data Analysis (TDA) to attention maps in transformer-based language models.

item.title: Deep-learning-based acceleration of MRI for radiotherapy planning of pediatric patients with brain tumors
item.description: Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) is a non-invasive diagnostic and radiotherapy (RT) planning tool, offering detailed insights into the anatomy of the human body.

item.title: Automatic Instruction Optimization for Open-source LLM Instruction Tuning
item.description: However, the manual creation of high-quality instruction datasets is costly, leading to the adoption of automatic generation of instruction pairs by LLMs as a popular alternative in the training of open-source LLMs.

item.title: BEND: Benchmarking DNA Language Models on biologically meaningful tasks
item.description: The genome sequence contains the blueprint for governing cellular processes.

item.title: Camera-Independent Single Image Depth Estimation from Defocus Blur
item.description: We created a synthetic dataset which can be used to test the camera independent performance of depth from defocus blur models.

item.title: Self-Supervised Deconfounding Against Spatio-Temporal Shifts: Theory and Modeling
item.description: It first encodes traffic data into two disentangled representations for associating invariant and variant ST contexts.

item.title: Orthogonally weighted $\ell_{2,1}$ regularization for rank-aware joint sparse recovery: algorithm and analysis
item.description: We propose and analyze an efficient algorithm for solving the joint sparse recovery problem using a new regularization-based method, named orthogonally weighted $\ell_{2, 1}$ ($\mathit{ow}\ell_{2, 1}$), which is specifically designed to take into account the rank of the solution matrix.

item.title: Board-to-Board: Evaluating Moonboard Grade Prediction Generalization
item.description: In this work, we apply classical and deep-learning modelling techniques to the 2016, 2017 and 2019 Moonboard datasets, achieving state of the art grade prediction performance with 0. 87 MAE and 1. 12 RMSE.

item.title: GLAD: Global-Local View Alignment and Background Debiasing for Unsupervised Video Domain Adaptation with Large Domain Gap
item.description: We specifically focus on scenarios with a substantial domain gap, in contrast to existing works primarily deal with small domain gaps between labeled source domains and unlabeled target domains.

item.title: Intrinsic Image Decomposition via Ordinal Shading
item.description: We encourage the model to learn an accurate decomposition by computing losses on the estimated shading as well as the albedo implied by the intrinsic model.

item.title: LowResource at BLP-2023 Task 2: Leveraging BanglaBert for Low Resource Sentiment Analysis of Bangla Language
item.description: This paper describes the system of the LowResource Team for Task 2 of BLP-2023, which involves conducting sentiment analysis on a dataset composed of public posts and comments from diverse social media platforms.

item.title: Machine-Guided Discovery of a Real-World Rogue Wave Model
item.description: Yet, it is still not clear how we can use the superior pattern matching abilities of machine learning models for scientific discovery.

item.title: Challenges in Video-Based Infant Action Recognition: A Critical Examination of the State of the Art
item.description: Automated human action recognition, a burgeoning field within computer vision, boasts diverse applications spanning surveillance, security, human-computer interaction, tele-health, and sports analysis.

item.title: A Survey of Graph Meets Large Language Model: Progress and Future Directions
item.description: First of all, we propose a new taxonomy, which organizes existing methods into three categories based on the role (i. e., enhancer, predictor, and alignment component) played by LLMs in graph-related tasks.

item.title: Towards a more inductive world for drug repurposing approaches
item.description: In this work, we first perform an in-depth evaluation of current DTI datasets and prediction models through a robust benchmarking process, and show that DTI prediction methods based on transductive models lack generalization and lead to inflated performance when evaluated as previously done in the literature, hence not being suited for drug repurposing approaches.

item.title: minimax: Efficient Baselines for Autocurricula in JAX
item.description: This compute requirement is a major obstacle to rapid innovation for the field.
